sect2.title: Introduction to nfs-utils
sect2.para: The nfs-utils package contains the userspace server and client tools necessary to use the kernel's nfs-abilities. NFS is a protocol that allows sharing file systems over the network.

sect2.title: Kernel Configuration
sect2.para: Enable the following options in the kernel configuration and recompile the kernel if neccessary:
sect2.screen: File systems: Network File Systems: NFS File System Support: M or Y NFS Server Support: M or Y
sect2.para: Select the appropriate sub-options that appear when the above options are selected.

sect2.title: Installation of nfs-utils
sect2.para: Before you compile the program, you need to be sure the "nobody" user and "nogroup" group are available. You can add these with the following commands:

userinput.command: groupadd -g 65534 nogroup && useradd -c nobody -d /home -g nogroup -s /bin/bash -u 65534 nobody

note.para: If your /usr directory is NFS mounted, you should install the executables in /sbin by passing an additional parameter --sbindir=/sbin to the above ./configure command.

sect3.title: Server Configutation
sect3.para: /etc/exports contains the exported directories on NFS servers. Refer to the exports manual page for the syntax of this file. Also refer to the NFS HowTo available at on how to configure the servers and clients in a secure manner. For example, for sharing the /home directory over the local network, the following line may be added:
Install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/nfs-server init script included in the package to start the server at boot.
Now create the /etc/sysconfig/nfs-server configuration file:

screen.userinput: cat > /etc/sysconfig/nfs-server << "EOF" PORT="2049" PROCESSES="8" QUOTAS="no" KILLDELAY="10" EOF

sect3.title: Client Configutation
sect3.para: /etc/fstab contains the directories that are to be mounted on the client. Alternately the partitions can be mounted by using the mount command with the proper options. To mount the /home partition, add the following to the /etc/fstab:
Install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/nfs-client init script included in the package to start the client services at boot.

sect2.para: The nfs-utils package contains getiversion, getkversion, locktest, nlmtest, rpcdebug, rpcgen, exportfs, lockd, mountd, nfsd, nfsstat, nhfsstone, rquotad, showmount, statd

sect3.title: exportfs
sect3.para: exportfs maintains a list of NFS exported directories.

sect3.title: lockd
sect3.para: lockd is the NFS lock manager.

sect3.title: mountd
sect3.para: mountd is the NFS mount daemon which checks client-permissions.

sect3.title: nfsd
sect3.para: nfsd is the user-space daemon of the NFS service.

sect3.title: nfsstat
sect3.para: nfsstat prints NFS statistics.

sect3.title: nhfsstone
sect3.para: nhfsstone is the NFS benchmark program.

sect3.title: rquotad
sect3.para: rquotad is the remote quota server communicating with the quota client.

sect3.title: showmount
sect3.para: showmount shows mount information for an NFS server.

sect3.title: statd
sect3.para: statd is the NFS status monitor which implements the NSM (Network Status Monitor) RPC protocol.
